title: E-liter 4K Scope
paragraphs: The E-liter 4K Scope is a main weapon in Splatoon 2 and Splatoon 3, and a successor to Splatoon's E-liter 3K Scope.

The E-liter 4K Scope is an E-liter 4K with a scope attached. Compared to the scopeless version it has enhanced range and a zoomed view for greater aiming precision, but players have their field of vision limited by the scope, and it can not store its charge in swim form. Besides this, all other stats are the same as the E-liter 4K, and it shares its sub and special weapons.

The E-liter 4K Scope is nearly identical in appearance to the E-liter 4K. The only difference between the two is that the E-liter 4K Scope has a scope attached to the gas pump handle and the back end of the barrel.
The E-liter 4K Scope comes with Ink Mines and Ink Storm.
It appears in three Octo Expansion stations:
- D02 One-Shot Station
- D05 All That 8-Ball Station
- G03 House Party Station
- ▲ Range when not fully charged is not reduced to match its unscoped variant.
- ▲ Time taken to fully charge is 2/60 seconds faster.
- ▲ Fully-charged ink consumption: 30% → 25%.
- ▼ Movement speed while not charging or firing is reduced by 8.3%

- ▼ Range is decreased by about 17%.
▼ Max range: 374 units → 310.5 units.
- ▼ Maximum damage without full charge: 100 → 80.
- ▼ There is a glow while charging and gets brighter the more the weapon is charged, increasing visibility for opponents.
- Promotional image
The E-liter 4K Scope returns in Splatoon 3 with a new design. It comes with Ink Mine and Wave Breaker, matching the E-liter 4K.
